page.title: 08Upland Vegetation.
page.content: The upland limestone supports many plants and flowers, even though it is grzed by sheep and cattle. In sheltered parts wild Lily of the Valley can be found and Columbine. Gorse and Thistles come in where the pasture is not closely controlled and also Blackberries are abundant. The Early Purple Orchid appears in the dales and Lords and Ladies and Mare's Tail. Elder is plentiful. Moon Daisies are abundant in summer and their petals are used in the well dressing pictures. There is a local superstition that anyone picking one of the wild blue Geraniums will bring on a thunderstorm! On the hilltops, in June, the tiny wild yellow Viola can be found.
